newsitem.title: USA: Clinton names Kennard to head FCC.
newsitem.headline: Clinton names Kennard to head FCC.

text.p: President Bill Clinton on Wednesday announced his intention to designate William Kennard, general counsel of the Federal Communications Commission, to be its next chairman.
Kennard, 40, has been the FCC's general counsel for 3-1/2 years. If, as expected, he wins Senate confirmation, he would be the first black to head the five-member regulatory agency.
Kennard would replace Reed Hundt, who has announced his plans to resign as chairman and leave the agency.
Clinton also formally nominated Michael Powell, the son of retired Army Chief of Staff Colin Powell, to be a member of the FCC.
Powell currently is the chief of staff of the Justice Department's antitrust division.
